articles.content: A corollary is a self-evident implication of already established knowledge.
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff,
The Philosophy of Objectivism lecture series, Lecture 2

articles.content:
Many of the most important truths in philosophy are neither primary axioms nor
theorems susceptible of discursive proof; rather, they are corollaries—most
often, corollaries of axioms.
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff, 
The Philosophy of Objectivism lecture series, Lecture 2
